pull.title: BIP 179: Name for payment recipient identifiers
pull.body:
This was discussed [here](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2019-October/017369.html) and got really good feedback.
This is the BIP draft for it.
Feedback appreciated.

events.body: @MarcoFalke Done, also asked on the ML

BIP title has changed, could someone change the title of the PR?
I have insufficient permissions.

rename.from: Add BIP: Redefinition of the term address
rename.to: New BIP: Replacing the term address

rename.from: New BIP: Replacing the term address
rename.to: New BIP: Terminology for payment recipient identifiers

events.body:
@MarcoFalke I added you as a co-author as no responded so far.
Which E-Mail should I use?
Squashed, could this get a BIP number now as it is probably ready? @luke-jr

rename.from: New BIP: Terminology for payment recipient identifiers
rename.to: New BIP 179: Terminology for payment recipient identifiers

events.body:
@luke-jr Thanks, updated, squashed and reworded.
What's next?

```
bip-0179.mediawiki has too-long TItle (45 > 44 char max) at scripts/buildtable.pl line 126, <$F> line 3.
```

rename.from: New BIP 179: Terminology for payment recipient identifiers
rename.to: BIP 179: Name for payment recipient identifiers

verification.payload:
tree b40979b432fcb14a04cae301596321e0d9c3ef9d
parent 6bcb38f2268cc411374df298392ad97eb5f97477
author Emil Engler <me@emilengler.com> 1571340368 +0200
committer Emil Engler <me@emilengler.com> 1573135109 +0100

Add BIP 179: Name for payment recipient identifiers

events.message: Add BIP 179: Name for payment recipient identifiers

events.body: @luke-jr Thanks for merging, what are the next steps until it gets accepted and reaches final?

@emilengler BIPs aren't "accepted" there is no central authority that could do that. A BIP is merged in the repo after basic formatting rules have been obeyed. Anyone is free to not implement or to implement a BIP.

The BIP Status field exists to reflect real-world status, so lacking specific conditions in BIP 2 (AFAICT), I guess it should become "Active" when there is a very obvious trend of adopting the proposed language.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+<pre>
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Titel: Redefinition of the term address
+  Author: Emil Engler <me@emilengler.com>
comments.body: I'd suggest to find one co-author, so that potential changes to the BIP can be addressed by either

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@
+<pre>
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Titel: Redefinition of the term address
+  Author: Emil Engler <me@emilengler.com>
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Informational
+  Created: 2019-10-17
+  License: Public Domain
comments.body: BIP2 recommends to use CC0 instead. And I think all new BIPs did that.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Titel: Redefinition of the term address
+  Author: Emil Engler 
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Informational
+  Created: 2019-10-17
+  License: Public Domain
+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' +Short: ''BIA''
comments.body: I think BIA causes more confusion than it serves as a easily recognizable identifier. Also it will be misleading, when in the (far) future, it will just be "Bitcoin invoice".

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Titel: Redefinition of the term address
+  Author: Emil Engler 
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Informational
+  Created: 2019-10-17
+  License: Public Domain
+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' +Short: ''BIA'' + +The term ''Bitcoin'' and ''Address'' are optional this has the following reasons: +For ''Bitcoin'': +* Useful for multicoin wallets to indicate that it belongs to Bitcoin +* Indicates a difference between a lightning and an on-chain invoice +For ''Address'': +* To not confuse users with a completely new term +* To show that it is where you send something to + +This gives us the four following possibilities: +* Bitcoin Invoice Address +* Bitcoin Invoice +* Invoice Address +* Invoice + +==Motivation== +Bitcoin addresses are intended to be only used '''once''' and you should generate a new one for every new incoming payment. +The term 'address' however indicates consistency because nearly everything on the internet or the offline world with the term 'address' +is something that rarely or even never changes (postal address, e-mail address, IP-Addresses (depends heavily on the provider), etc.) +The motivation for this BIP is to change the term address to something that indicates that the address is connected to a single transaction. + +==Rationale== +The reason why we use ''Bitcoin Invoice Address'' or just ''Invoice'' is to show that it is more like a temporary thing. +We decided to keep Bitcoin and Address as optional terms for the reasons named above. + +==Backwards Compatibility== +Because this is an informational BIP it does not break any compatibility. +However some documentation, for example BIP 21, needs to get updated.
comments.body: I think this can be omitted. Whenever a software implements this UI change, they will update their documentation as well.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Titel: Redefinition of the term address
+  Author: Emil Engler 
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Informational
+  Created: 2019-10-17
+  License: Public Domain
+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' +Short: ''BIA'' + +The term ''Bitcoin'' and ''Address'' are optional this has the following reasons: +For ''Bitcoin'': +* Useful for multicoin wallets to indicate that it belongs to Bitcoin +* Indicates a difference between a lightning and an on-chain invoice +For ''Address'': +* To not confuse users with a completely new term +* To show that it is where you send something to + +This gives us the four following possibilities: +* Bitcoin Invoice Address +* Bitcoin Invoice +* Invoice Address +* Invoice + +==Motivation== +Bitcoin addresses are intended to be only used '''once''' and you should generate a new one for every new incoming payment. +The term 'address' however indicates consistency because nearly everything on the internet or the offline world with the term 'address' +is something that rarely or even never changes (postal address, e-mail address, IP-Addresses (depends heavily on the provider), etc.) +The motivation for this BIP is to change the term address to something that indicates that the address is connected to a single transaction. + +==Rationale== +The reason why we use ''Bitcoin Invoice Address'' or just ''Invoice'' is to show that it is more like a temporary thing. +We decided to keep Bitcoin and Address as optional terms for the reasons named above. + +==Backwards Compatibility== +Because this is an informational BIP it does not break any compatibility. +However some documentation, for example BIP 21, needs to get updated. + +==Reference Implementation== +''Not implemented yet''
comments.body: I think a list of "reference implementations" might be spammy and doesn't really help other implementations. To implement this in a given piece of software, a replacement of the term "bitcoin address" with "bitcoin invoice address" in the user facing strings should be sufficient.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,54 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Titel: Redefinition of the term address
+  Author: Emil Engler 
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Informational
+  Created: 2019-10-17
+  License: Public Domain
+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' +Short: ''BIA'' + +The term ''Bitcoin'' and ''Address'' are optional this has the following reasons: +For ''Bitcoin'': +* Useful for multicoin wallets to indicate that it belongs to Bitcoin +* Indicates a difference between a lightning and an on-chain invoice +For ''Address'': +* To not confuse users with a completely new term +* To show that it is where you send something to + +This gives us the four following possibilities: +* Bitcoin Invoice Address +* Bitcoin Invoice +* Invoice Address +* Invoice + +==Motivation== +Bitcoin addresses are intended to be only used '''once''' and you should generate a new one for every new incoming payment. +The term 'address' however indicates consistency because nearly everything on the internet or the offline world with the term 'address' +is something that rarely or even never changes (postal address, e-mail address, IP-Addresses (depends heavily on the provider), etc.) +The motivation for this BIP is to change the term address to something that indicates that the address is connected to a single transaction. + +==Rationale== +The reason why we use ''Bitcoin Invoice Address'' or just ''Invoice'' is to show that it is more like a temporary thing. +We decided to keep Bitcoin and Address as optional terms for the reasons named above. + +==Backwards Compatibility== +Because this is an informational BIP it does not break any compatibility. +However some documentation, for example BIP 21, needs to get updated. + +==Reference Implementation== +''Not implemented yet'' + +==Acknowledgements== +Thanks to Chris Belcher for the suggestion of the term 'Bitcoin Invoice Address' + +==Copyright== +This BIP is released into the Public Domain.
comments.body: See comment above.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,46 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Titel: Replacing the term address
+  Author: Emil Engler 
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Informational
+  Created: 2019-10-17
+  License: CC0
+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' + +The term ''Bitcoin'' and ''Address'' are optional this has the following reasons: +For ''Bitcoin'': +* Useful for multicoin wallets to indicate that it belongs to Bitcoin +* Indicates a difference between a lightning and an on-chain invoice +For ''Address'': +* To not confuse users with a completely new term +* To show that it is where you send something to

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,46 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED

+  Author: Emil Engler 
+  Status: Draft

+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' + +The term ''Bitcoin'' and ''Address'' are optional this has the following reasons: +For ''Bitcoin'': +* Useful for multicoin wallets to indicate that it belongs to Bitcoin +* Indicates a difference between a lightning and an on-chain invoice +For ''Address'': +* To not confuse users with a completely new term +* To show that it is where you send something to + +This gives us the four following possibilities: +* Bitcoin Invoice Address +* Bitcoin Invoice +* Invoice Address +* Invoice
comments.body: "Invoice" alone may be too confused with regular invoices in general.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,46 @@ +

+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is:
comments.body: A definition is needed. Particularly one that should be inclusive of Lightning or other L2 networks.

Was the old one sufficient?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,46 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Titel: Replacing the term address
+  Author: Emil Engler 
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Informational
+  Created: 2019-10-17
+  License: CC0
+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' + +The term ''Bitcoin'' and ''Address'' are optional this has the following reasons: +For ''Bitcoin'': +* Useful for multicoin wallets to indicate that it belongs to Bitcoin +* Indicates a difference between a lightning and an on-chain invoice +For ''Address'': +* To not confuse users with a completely new term +* To show that it is where you send something to + +This gives us the four following possibilities: +* Bitcoin Invoice Address +* Bitcoin Invoice +* Invoice Address +* Invoice + +==Motivation== +Bitcoin addresses are intended to be only used '''once''' and you should generate a new one for every new incoming payment. +The term 'address' however indicates consistency because nearly everything on the internet or the offline world with the term 'address' +is something that rarely or even never changes (postal address, e-mail address, IP-Addresses (depends heavily on the provider), etc.) +The motivation for this BIP is to change the term address to something that indicates that the address is connected to a single transaction. + +==Rationale== +The reason why we use ''Bitcoin Invoice Address'' or just ''Invoice'' is to show that it is more like a temporary thing. +We decided to keep Bitcoin and Address as optional terms for the reasons named above. +
comments.body:
No, it doesn't actually address backward compatibility.

You want something like "since the term used will initially be `invoice address`, it includes the existing term `address` and should be immediately recognisable to users"

comments.body: "A bitcoin invoice address is a human-readable encoding of a scriptPubKey, for example bech32 addresses BIP173 or base58 legacy addresses"?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Title: Terminology for payment recipient identifiers
+  Author: Emil Engler 
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Informational
+  Created: 2019-10-17
+  License: CC0
+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' + +==Motivation== +Bitcoin addresses are intended to be only used '''once''' and you should generate a new one for every new incoming payment. +The term 'address' however indicates consistency because nearly everything on the internet or the offline world with the term 'address' +is something that rarely or even never changes (postal address, e-mail address, IP-Addresses (depends heavily on the provider), etc.) +The motivation for this BIP is to change the term address to something that indicates that the address is connected to a single transaction. + +==Rationale== +The reason why we use ''Bitcoin Invoice Address'' or just ''Invoice'' is to show that it is more like a temporary thing. +The terms ''Bitcoin'' and ''Address'' are optional this has the following reasons: +For ''Bitcoin'': +* Useful for multicoin wallets to indicate that it belongs to Bitcoin +* Indicates a difference between a lightning and an on-chain invoice +For ''Address'': +* To not confuse users with a completely new term +* To show that it is where you send something to +* To not break backwards compatibility + +This gives us the four following possibilities: +* Bitcoin Invoice Address +* Bitcoin Invoice +* Invoice Address +* Invoice + +==Backwards Compatibility== +To avoid issues, the 'Address' suffix is permitted, but not recommended. +The suffix 'address' remains so users should be immediately able to recognize it until the new term is widely known.
comments.body: The suffix is capitalized once and not capitalized in the next line.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Title: Terminology for payment recipient identifiers
+  Author: Emil Engler 
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Informational
+  Created: 2019-10-17
+  License: CC0
+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' + +==Motivation== +Bitcoin addresses are intended to be only used '''once''' and you should generate a new one for every new incoming payment. +The term 'address' however indicates consistency because nearly everything on the internet or the offline world with the term 'address' +is something that rarely or even never changes (postal address, e-mail address, IP-Addresses (depends heavily on the provider), etc.) +The motivation for this BIP is to change the term address to something that indicates that the address is connected to a single transaction. + +==Rationale== +The reason why we use ''Bitcoin Invoice Address'' or just ''Invoice'' is to show that it is more like a temporary thing.
comments.body:
The "temporary" seems a bit off. It's not really temporary, an invoice doesn't change or go away. It's just that it is single-use.
Therefore, how about "[]is to emphasize that it is single-use."

+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' + +==Motivation== +Bitcoin addresses are intended to be only used '''once''' and you should generate a new one for every new incoming payment. +The term 'address' however indicates consistency because nearly everything on the internet or the offline world with the term 'address' +is something that rarely or even never changes (postal address, e-mail address, IP-Addresses (depends heavily on the provider), etc.) +The motivation for this BIP is to change the term address to something that indicates that the address is connected to a single transaction. + +==Rationale== +The reason why we use ''Bitcoin Invoice Address'' or just ''Invoice'' is to show that it is more like a temporary thing. +The terms ''Bitcoin'' and ''Address'' are optional this has the following reasons:
comments.body:
How about:
"are optional _for the_ following reasons:"

+  BIP: UNDEFINED

comments.body:
No, that's too specific to technical details (and excludes L2 stuff), and neglects to cover the intent/purpose of the invoice address.

Maybe something like "A bitcoin invoice [address] is a string of characters that can be used to indicate the intended recipient and purpose of a transaction." ?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,56 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Title: Terminology for payment recipient identifiers
+  Author: Emil Engler 
+          MarcoFalke 
+          Luke Dashjr

+  Type: Informational

+  License: CC0
+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' + +The ''Bitcoin'' and ''Address'' parts are optional. +The address suffix should only be used as a transitional step. + +A ''Bitcoin'' Invoice ''Address'' is a string of characters that can be used to indicate the intended recipient and purpose of a transaction. + +==Motivation== +Bitcoin addresses are intended to be only used '''once''' and you should generate a new one for every new incoming payment.
comments.body: Shouldn't this sentence start with `Bitcoin invoice addresses`? :grin:

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,56 @@ +
+  BIP: UNDEFINED
+  Title: Terminology for payment recipient identifiers
+  Author: Emil Engler 
+          MarcoFalke 
+          Luke Dashjr 
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Informational
+  Created: 2019-10-17
+  License: CC0
+
+ +==Abstract== +This BIP proposes a new term for 'address' + +==Specification== +The new term is: +''Bitcoin'' '''Invoice''' ''Address'' + +The ''Bitcoin'' and ''Address'' parts are optional. +The address suffix should only be used as a transitional step. + +A ''Bitcoin'' Invoice ''Address'' is a string of characters that can be used to indicate the intended recipient and purpose of a transaction. + +==Motivation== +Bitcoin addresses are intended to be only used '''once''' and you should generate a new one for every new incoming payment. +The term 'address' however indicates consistency because nearly everything on the internet or the offline world with the term 'address' +is something that rarely or even never changes (postal address, e-mail address, IP-Addresses (depends heavily on the provider), etc.)
comments.body: In English "email" is much more commonly written without a dash. Similarly, drop the dash in "IP address" and don't capitalize the "a" (see e.g. [Wikipedia:IP address](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IP_address)).
